intro: Pimpinella rhomboidea, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are narrow and pinnately divided, giving it a delicate appearance. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas.
